website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you like the idea of the dual heaters. Otherwise we recommend the Surebonder.
pros: Can produce a steady flow of melted glue thanks to its dual heaters
Has extension and spreader nozzles that are easy to use
cons: The trigger feels slightly tight and requires a stronger grip than others on our list

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a glue gun which actually works. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a glue gun which actually works. I have tried so many glue guns before, and all of them have something missing; either it does not melt, or it overheats after a while, or the nozzle is too chubby, or the trigger is too hard or has problems taking the second glue stick. Even though this one is little oversize, it is light enough, comes with multiple nozzles and keeps the heat at the right point.
customer_reviews.author: CaliBear

customer_reviews.title: defective construction.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled at the factory incorrectly. The original tip was forcibly screwed into the gun and damaged the threads. Impossible to reinsert desired tip. As far as glue guns are concerned, steer clear of Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bloomquist

customer_reviews.title: Be careful. It gets very HOT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has an automatic off setting. However, I didn’t check how hot this glue gun gets and let my son use the glue gun for a small project. He burnt himself and had to go to the ER. Four months later he still has a scar from the burn. Lesson learned,this glue gun gets HOT.
customer_reviews.author: Lara L. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Good glue gun, with dual temp feature.
customer_reviews.text: So far it is working well. I like the dual heat feature, the automatic shut off, and replaceable glue tips. The only minor complaint is the rubber nose piece is not fitted/aligned to the lock nut for the replaceable tips. The unit seems a little less robust than my old one...we shall see how well it does over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Grodsky

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this a lot. It is a good product. I needs some tweaking though. It leaks a lot of glue as the orings don't work well. One of the heaters arced out a few weeks ago with a big flash and pop. Now it is only a low temp glue gun. Otherwise it worked well. I like the different tips.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Gun
customer_reviews.text: Good gun but the tip wore out, when i replaced them with some more the glue ended backing up into the gun and making them unusable. The tips that I bought may have not been the correct one s for this gun but lack information made it hard to be sure what tips would work. The auto off function is nice but not ideal in a high yield production facility where products are being assembled and have different steps in between gluing.
customer_reviews.author: BatteriesInAFlash

customer_reviews.title: I figured this Stanley would be a nice upgrade. Not much better than the cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: After using a bargain glue gun, I figured this Stanley would be a nice upgrade. Not much better than the cheap ones. They include several different nozzles, but I don't need them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy's Pop

customer_reviews.title: easy to get a bad burn from the very hot ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and the rubber guard over glue exit can be removed to get into tight places. Have used it a few times with high temp glue. One should not be distracted when using, easy to get a bad burn from the very hot glue.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for any project
customer_reviews.text: Hundreds of uses and quality in design. Great glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: Rellim

customer_reviews.title: i have to hold the trigger down pretty hard to get the glue to come out
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for about a month, one of the attachements broke after 1 use, it simply just snapped off, Now the product leaks the glue in resting position, and when I pull the trigger to get glue, nothing wants to come out, i have to hold the trigger down pretty hard to get the glue to come out, but when it is just sitting the glue literally jut falls out! No so happy with this at all! =(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Glue sticks are the extra thick kind, not the small hobbist style. The gun heats up pretty quick and can start using in about 1 minute. Haven't tried the extension tubes yet, but they look like they will burn you easily but get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Secunda
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun mainly for it's interchangeable nozzles. However, when it arrived, it turned out that the default nozzle was almost impossible to remove, due to a faulty thread in the gun itself, In removing the nozzle, the thread was stripped, so that none of the nozzles now can screw on!! Gun itself may be OK, - I don't know, since it became useless only a few minutes after I received it! Wouldn't buy another unless the thread was checked and found to be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Walentin

customer_reviews.title: Dripping
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I using it for longer period of time, and when I put it on the table between task, it drips. I use paper protection on my table, so it doesn't bother to much, however I can see someone being annoyed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jo T

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t advance the glue stick! Thought buying a better product I’d get high performance, not so. Will go back to my cheap gun that works everytime
customer_reviews.author: Georgi

customer_reviews.title: Husband delighted with new gun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my husband a new (glue) gun for his birthday and he loves it! It's good sized, so it fits his extra large hands and he's AMPED about the additional glue spreading nozzles. He had a Black & Decker glue gun that was his favorite for years. Sadly it it seems to have been discontinued so I was looking for that when I found this Stanley model. He is so happy and he also appreciated the extra glue sticks that came with it. It includes a small variety pack of different types of glue. I would recommend this item for an adult with average size hands or larger.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as high quality as I expected
customer_reviews.text: the fold out stand is junk. cheaply made, not well attached, I needed to fold it up to get it out of the way and then it is awkward to get down again. An unattached stand would be way better. Although it will be easy enough to make one. My other major complaint is the rubber guard around the nozzle. It is too big and almost always in the way. It is easy enough to remove and then you have a nice long nozzle. I feel that it's an okay gun but it's way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: shadowalker

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: This cost the same as replacement tips for my old gun. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: I have one that I used for 5 years old just got some back ups for my boatrepaire
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is not just any Glue Gun. It has extra tips that can be screwed on the tip to give you various types of forms of glue for difficult problems. Best buy!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: amazed by the qualitity
customer_reviews.text: works great and after 6 years still going strong have to just purchase more glue sticks but that is to be expected but holds great and have used on numerous projects I suggest using and purchasing the yellow "heavy duty" sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin L. Bates

customer_reviews.title: I hate TWO of these die on me out of nowhere
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these from Amazon and both were defective.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hope it lasts as long as my first Stanley glue gun did..
customer_reviews.author: GeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Good for Crafters
customer_reviews.text: The flat needles were just what I needed for some of my crafts. Made the job a lot easer for me.
customer_reviews.author: SantaClaus12

customer_reviews.title: Gluegun
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Heats quick and is easy to use. Came with lots of Glue. I just wish it was cordless
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy

customer_reviews.title: READY SET DON'T GO
customer_reviews.text: GREAT GUN WITH ONE BIG PROBLEM - LIKE MOST GLUE GUNS IT TAKES FOREVER TO HEAT UP TO WORKING TEMP. BUT UNLIKE MOST GUNS THIS ONE HAS A UNUSED TIME SAFETY SHUTOFF FEATURE. SOOOO - IF YOU DON'T GET BACK TO YOU R GUN FAST ENOUGH YOU HAVE TO START THE PROCESS ALL OVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Buss

customer_reviews.title: pure trash
customer_reviews.text: already sent back. 4.76 Walmart gule gun worked better. 12 minutes and it spit out 1/4 tea spoon full...NEEEEVERRRRRR buy this junk
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schrecker

customer_reviews.title: Was working great but It broke very fast
customer_reviews.text: Was working great but It broke very fast, and I checked and there is no where to contact the seller my only option was leaving a bad review
customer_reviews.author: STERLION

customer_reviews.title: It's a glue gun!
customer_reviews.text: It's a glue gun! Works perfectly for me. I like the attachments that allow for a longer and flat nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I received the glue gun on time and it works wonderfully. I will be able to use the product for many projects.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D. Resig

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, heats up fast and seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Anony Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Too Big!!
customer_reviews.text: I have average to long fingers for a woman and I could barely grip this monster, much less control it. This is for BIG Men doing BIG projects! While the nozzles might be small, the gun itself is too big for detailed work.
customer_reviews.author: Em Deegee

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd read these reviews before buying this -- like some others, the gun never dispersed a drop of glue. I heated until smoking and smelling. No glue. It looks like the same problem that others have had. So I think there's a quality control issue or design flaw. Whatever it is, I'll be going to the store to return it and get a new glue gun. And it won't be a Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: "Contractor Grade" Misleading
customer_reviews.text: While the words "Contractor Grade" are misleading, this glue gun is "Top of the Line" for the serious hobbiest, although not intended for the Home Building Industry. Keeping in mind that this gun shuts off in approximately 15 minutes after trigger activation, I had no problems with trigger malfunctioning. Forcing trigger on cold glue stick, will cause problems with most all guns. My wife and I have used this gun, everyday for the past week and it has performed flawlessly. We highly recommend it for the serious and skilled hobbiest. The extra extended tips and dual heat ranges are extremely handy and useful.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Nice to know that it was not just MY glue gun that did NOT work!
customer_reviews.text: I spent more because I wanted a "better" glue gun; however, it only worked once ... after that it would not feed glue through. I trusted the brand name ... would never recommend it. Sounded good with the attachment but when no glue would come through it ... I now use smaller cheaper gun that works; all the time ~ every time!!
customer_reviews.author: kspenguin

customer_reviews.title: No problems, No issues, little pricey
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine glue gun. Acurate and very useful. The saftey feature can be a little frustrating if you don't plan ahead and layout your work before starting. (no real problem, but unexpected) I'm happy with everything but the price.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Green

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: This heavy hot-melt glue-gun user was thrilled when she opened her new Stanley GR-100 christmas gift anticipating it would vastly improve her speed and gluing finesse; alas, the trigger on it is a great deal tougher to pull than my .38 (no mean feat - perhaps manufacturer wants you to carefully reflect upon the consequences of wanton gluing . . . )!!!! rendering it impossible for me to use at all! Gifter purchased it from off-beaten-track store and we never had time to exchange or get $$$ back for - save yourself a lousy experience and buy something else from someone easy to return to (as is in my experience Amazon[.com]).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as nails.
customer_reviews.text: While I do recommend this gun if you're serious about being provided with a yellow multi-tiered and scaleable way of sticking things together (and note, this does have 2 nozzles -- great idea!) I have to still reccommend nails even more highly when you're dealing with wood.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Benson

customer_reviews.title: Stanley GR100 Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: The glue gun works great until you use one of the extension nozzles. Having a nozzle fall apart in the middle of a project is quite an experience. The aluminum nozzle expands much more than the copper extension tube which allows the copper tube to fall out into the middle of the hot glue. They should be made of the same material. This is a safety hazzard.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: STANLEY GR100 GLUE-PRO DUALMELT GLUE GUN
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS GLUE GUN 3 WEEKS AGO.DID NOT HAVE MUCH LUCK WITH IT.IT DOES NOT GET HOT ENOUGH TO MELT THE GLUE TO COME OUT OF NOZZLE.TRIED DIFFERENT TYPES OF GLUE STICKS & SWITCH THE HEAT SETTINGS,STILL NO LUCK.BOUGHT A CHEAP GLUE GUN THROUGH TMART AND IT WORKS GREAT AT LESS THEN HALF THE PRICE OF THIS ONE.RATING 0 OUT 5 STARS.DON'T BUY AND KEEP YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: KICKER

customer_reviews.title: stanley hot glue gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these glue guns, and on both of them the trigger failed within aprox. 8 hours of use. Once the trigger fails, the glue gun will not heat up. They are junk and you would be wasting your money if you bought one.
customer_reviews.author: gunars

customer_reviews.title: Not Hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy because I expected to be hotter than the glue I already. Because of the temp control
customer_reviews.author: kimr1846

customer_reviews.title: NO ME ENVIARON EL MODELO QUE PEDÍ
customer_reviews.text: LA PISTOLA DE SILICON QUE RECIBI, NO COINCIDE CON LA QUE ORDENÉ, DE HECHO NI EN EL COLOR, LA QUE PEDÍ ES TAL COMO SE VE EN LA FOTO Y ME ENVIARON, UNA NEGRA Y DE OTRO MODELO, SIN EMBARGO LA PROBÉ Y FUNCIONA BIÉN Y ES DÚAL...LA RECOMIENDO UN EXCELENTE PRODUCTO,, AH, Y ES MUY GRANDE...
customer_reviews.author: Monica Alvarez

product_meta.title: Stanley GR100 Glue-Pro DualMelt Glue Gun
product_meta.description:
Industrial performance with consumer appeal. Auto shut-off light for safety, reliability, and extended life. Dual heater for 40-percent more glue output. Temperature switch for high and low temperature glue applications. On/Off light and protected nozzle for added safety. Soft, comfort grip, non-slip trigger action.

AMAZON.COM
The Stanley Glue-Pro DualMelt Glue Gun is ideal for repairs, wood projects, light manufacturing, and model work. It features dual heaters for high capacity, delivering consistent glue flow at 40 percent more glue output. Its covered nozzle prevents burns during use. Other features include an automatic shutoff mechanism; a comfort-grip handle; and a high/low temperature adjustment. The glue gun comes with an extension nozzle, a spreader nozzle, and 18 sticks of assorted glue.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Stanley Works, originally a bolt and door hardware manufacturing company located in New Britain, Connecticut; was founded in 1843 by Frederick T. Stanley. A few years later, in 1857, Frederick’s cousin, Henry Stanley, founded The Stanley Rule and Level Company. In 1920, The Rule and Level Company merged with The Stanley Works and would go on to become it’s famous Hand Tools Division. Over the years, The Stanley Works has produced some of the most innovative and useful tools ever made. Among these tools are the Bailey Plane, the Surform shaper, the PowerLock tape rule and most recently the FatMax line of products. Today, more than ever, Stanley continues to be an industry leader in tool innovation. In 2001, Stanley introduced more than 100 new products, bringing to 400 the number of new products introduced in the past four years. As a direct result of Stanley’s commitment to excellence, Stanley was awarded the Prestigious Golden Hammer Award, presented for New Product Innovation in both 2000 and 2001.

See more
feature_bullets: Contractor-grade glue gun ideal for repairs, wood projects, and more
Dual heaters provide 40% more glue output and consistent flow
Covered nozzle for burn prevention; automatic shut-off for safety
